docs.title: 🧬 Protein Structure Explorer
docs.text: Welcome to the Protein Structure Explorer, a powerful web-based bioinformatics tool built to visualize and analyze protein structures easily and interactively.

docs.title: 🎯 Purpose
docs.text: The Protein Structure Explorer is created to simplify structural bioinformatics, allowing quick and effective protein structure analysis suitable for educational and research purposes.

docs.title: 🛠️ Technology Stack
docs.text:
• Python with Flask
  • BioPython and NumPy
  • JavaScript with NGL Viewer and Plotly
  • Bootstrap 5

docs.title: 🚀 Project Status
docs.text: This project was developed as part of an educational portfolio, aiming for admission into an undergraduate program in bioinformatics and computational biology.

docs.title: 🚀 Features
docs.text: The Protein Structure Explorer includes several essential features:

docs.title: 🧬 Protein Visualization
docs.text: Interactively explore protein 3D structures directly from the Protein Data Bank.

docs.title: 🔍 Structural Analysis
docs.text: Analyze residues, chains, and the center of mass.

docs.title: ⚙️ Mutation Simulation
docs.text: Model mutations and calculate metrics like RMSD and COM shifts.

docs.title: 📊 Ramachandran Plots
docs.text: Visualize phi (φ) and psi (ψ) angles to evaluate protein structural validity.

docs.title: 📐 Structural Comparison
docs.text: Easily compute and visualize the RMSD between two protein structures.

docs.title: 💻 Modern Web Interface
docs.text: Built with Flask and Bootstrap, providing a clean, user-friendly experience.

docs.title: 💻 Local Installation
docs.text:
Clone the repository and set up the virtual environment:

git clone https://github.com/katezuu/Protein_Explorer.git
cd Protein_Explorer
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/Mac
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows
pip install -r requirements.txt
python app.py

Then open your browser at:

http://localhost:5000

docs.title: 🐳 Docker (Recommended)
docs.text:
Pull and run the Docker image:

docker pull katezu/protein-explorer:latest
docker run -d -p 5000:5000 katezu/protein-explorer:latest
Then open your browser at:

http://localhost:5000

docs.title: 🧬 Analyze a Protein Structure
docs.text:
1. Enter the 4-character PDB ID into the form.
  2. Click "Analyze Structure".
  3. View interactive 3D protein structures and structural details.

docs.title: ⚗️ Mutation Analysis
docs.text:
1. Select a chain and residue number.
  2. Enter the original and mutated amino acids (one-letter codes).
  3. Click "Analyse Mutation".
  4. Check structural metrics (RMSD and COM shift) and visual mutation highlighting.

docs.title: 🔎 Compare Two Proteins
docs.text:
1. Enter two valid PDB IDs.
  2. Click "Analyze Structures".
  3. View comparative RMSD and individual structural data side-by-side.
